game

Class SpriteSheet

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.SpriteSheet

  • public class SpriteSheet
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SpriteSheet(java.awt.image.BufferedImage ss) 
      SpriteSheet(java.awt.image.BufferedImage ss, int width, int height)
      This constructor is useful if the image is already loaded from its path otherwise, use the main constructor
      SpriteSheet(java.lang.String path, int width, int height)
      This is the main constructor of the class, building a sprite sheet from its path

      This get function return the width of one sprite

    • Constructor Detail

      • SpriteSheet

        public SpriteSheet(java.awt.image.BufferedImage ss)

      • SpriteSheet

        public SpriteSheet(java.lang.String path,
           int width,
           int height)
        This is the main constructor of the class, building a sprite sheet from its path
        Parameters:
        path - is the path to the image (often "img/XXX.png")
        width - is the width of one sprite
        height - is the height of one sprite

      • SpriteSheet

        public SpriteSheet(java.awt.image.BufferedImage ss,
           int width,
           int height)
        This constructor is useful if the image is already loaded from its path otherwise, use the main constructor
        Parameters:
        ss - is the image which will be the sprite sheet
        width - is the width of one sprite
        height - is the height of one sprite

    • Method Detail

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        This get function return the width of one sprite
        Returns:
        the width of one sprite

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        This get function return the height of one sprite
        Returns:
        the height of one sprite

      • setSize

        public void setSize(int width,
           int height)
        This function is here to set the size of one Sprite if it hasn't been correctly set
        Parameters:
        width - is the width of a sprite
        height - is the height of a sprite

      • getSprite

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getSprite(int n)
        This method is giving a sprite depending on its position in the sprite sheet
        Parameters:
        n - is the position in the sprite sheet (starting from 0)
        Returns:
        a BufferedImage, corresponding to sprite at nth position

      • getSprite

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getSprite(int x,
                                     int y)
        This method is giving a sprite depending on its coords on the sprite sheet
        Parameters:
        x - is the X coordinate
        y - is the Y coordinate
        Returns:
        a BufferedImage, corresponding to sprite at nth position
